messages.content: How do you tackle Replication, Failover & Business Continuity in Snowflake

In Snowflake, you can handle replication, failover, and business continuity by replicating and failing over databases across multiple Snowflake accounts. This involves redirecting client connections to ensure continuity in case of disasters. You can achieve this through key tasks and concepts provided by Snowflake for maintaining business continuity and disaster recovery [Source: Using Snowflake | Snowflake Documentation].

messages.content: What do you do replication in Snowflake

In Snowflake, replication can be achieved by replicating and failing over databases across multiple Snowflake accounts. This process involves redirecting client connections to ensure business continuity and disaster recovery. By setting up replication tasks and configuring failover mechanisms, you can establish redundant copies of your data and services to maintain continuous operations in case of failures or disasters [Source: Using Snowflake | Snowflake Documentation].
